message: @geekwhisperer Hmm, never thought about it that way.
I'm not sure. I've seen others define a geek as someone who's very interested in a certain subject and knows a lot about it.  So maybe a nerd is just a general know-it-all?
If you've watched Buffy I see Willow as starting as a nerd, and becoming a geek as the show progressed.
Do you see one as good or bad?
@geekwhisperer Well, except for Season Six, of course.
I use them both to identify myself.  I haven't heard a good reason to pick one over the other. They both sound good to me.  Dork sounds a bit more negative, though.  YMMV.
I don't mind geek or nerd, but I do view geek as more positive.
I associate geek with better social skills.
@geekwhisperer There's a connotation of extreme enthusiasm associated with the word geek.  Like when people say they're 'geeked out' about the new Batwoman comic or BSG spin-off.
@geekwhisperer That reminds me. I should totally create a Whedonverse topic for the Sci-Fi group!  Thanks!
Here's my contribution to the geek vs. nerd debate http://geekwhisperin.wordpress.com/2011/03/31/geek-vs-nerd-vs-dork/
